pros: Coworkers and Leadership are the best!
cons: Salaries could increase for Clinical Staff

pros: Nothing,I worked in IT, place is a joke. They go through system admins every 6 to 9 months.If your thinking of applying for anything in IT, don't touch it, run!
cons: See Pros... don't work here, at least in IT that is.

job_title: School Based Therapist in Littleton, CO
pros: Good work life balance, direct supervisors are good advocates for their team.
cons: Low pay, draining at times. Limited growth opportunities for therapists.

pros: I can't say enough good things about this company. training is great, people are passionate and care about eachothers success. this is a breath of fresh air.
cons: like any other behavioral health clinic, you are seeing clients at their most vulnerable moments. however, it is very rewarding to know that the work makes a difference.

job_title: Behavioral Health Therapist II in Castle Rock, CO
pros: Some Pros I have experienced while at AHN are a supportive team, flexibility with schedule, great work life balance, and good supervision. This community mental health agency is not like others I have worked in. AHN changed the work pace now where you get 75 minute time blocks per session (52 mins) plus notes, and extra paperwork in between. It makes therapy and work very manageable. Case load is about 52- 55 total (you see about 28 a week).
cons: Cons are the monthly productively status updates. I understand they have to measure our performance somehow so that is why they do this. I have not had issues in this area but it would make anyone nervous that they are being monitored for cancelations and no shows that are out of their control. Productivity is 85% or higher which is not bad. Their are a lot of factors they consider not just the productivity. So don't get too stressed.

job_title: Medical Billing Specialist in Denver, CO
pros: Remote work and flexible time off
cons: Micromanager, training was horrid, negative environment

pros: Great culture and environment. Supportive team and management.
cons: Adjusting to telehealth and new client preferences

pros: I have worked at AllHealth for over 7 years and I plan to stick around as long as I can. The culture is great. I am supported in having a work life balance, my feedback is heard, and get to work with wonderful people who care deeply about the clients we serve. I have been able to grow personally and professionally as a result of my experiences with this company.
cons: Change is frequent, but there is always an effort made to help understand the WHY behind changes.

pros: Leadership that listens and genuinely cares, above average pay, bonuses, culture of gratitude, meaningful work, loads of PTO, collaborative multidisciplinary environment, knowledgeable and engaging in diversity considerations, non-profit, constant push for improvement and cutting edge interventions.
cons: At times an overwhelming work load. But what CMHC doesn’t have that at times?

review_title: What you expect from community based clinical work
job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician II in Littleton, CO
pros: Understanding work environment and great entry level learning opportunities/trainings.
cons: High turn over rate for clinical-based positions.

pros: Everyone is friendly and the work environment is positive. Excellent work/life balance. PTO is very generous.
cons: No room for growth, if that is important to you.

review_title: Good time off, difficult to keep up with caseload
pros: Generous time off, flexible with schedule
cons: Very high caseload as a therapist

job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician II in Littleton, CO
pros: Competitive pay for community mental health, great coworkers, good company communication
cons: Although the pay is competitive, it is not nearly enough for having a masters degree.

review_title: Proud to work at a non-profit that cares about its employees
job_title: Behavioal Health Clinician in Littleton, CO
pros: AllHealth's new employee orientation was the best and most organized introduction to a company that I've ever experienced.  It set a good tone for what was to come.  There has been a lot of transition in the past few years so some of the long-term employees seemed to be uncomfortable with the changes, but from what I've encountered the changes have been entirely transparent and the mission to better the agency noble.  I am able to do my job with little interference and I truly feel my feedback is valued.  Altogether it has been a great experience, particularly coming from previous agencies where I felt like a number.   It is entirely possible for therapists to get all notes and paperwork done by the end of the day, which is rare in the mental health field.  I find the benefits package to be outstanding and the overall mission of the organization to be inspiring.
cons: Some of the longer term employees have a sour attitude, which is somewhat understandable given the many changes the agency has seen over the last couple of years and perhaps the burnout they experience as a result of working in community mental health for an extended period of time.  I don't let it bother me and instead focus on my personal experience.

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Littleton, CO
pros:
Co Workers 
Pay 
Culture of kindness
cons:
Can be dangerous 
Not enough training 
No advancement opportunities without a license

pros: I recently started with AllHealth after working for another community mental health center. I was looking for a job closer to where I live and for a change of pace. My only knowledge about AllHealth was from a few years ago and most of it was negative. In the few months that I have been with the company, I have been impressed by management/executive's intentional effort to rebrand and create a place where employees want to work and are happy. Work/life balance has been acknowledged multiple times since I started 2 months ago and there are a number of feedback processes in place where the exec team is actively looking for feedback on areas to improve. My salary is very competitive for a community mental health agency, so that has also been a nice perk. Their new employee orientation was one of the most cohesive and engaging trainings I have experienced and was much appreciated by me.
cons: I haven't been in the organization for long enough to have clear ideas of any glaring cons, so most of mine are related to my job specifically. I did feel that the team based training (outside of the organization wide training) was not very cohesive and lacked specific structure. A few things that my other community mental health agency provided that I have missed were health insurance reimbursement for employees who chose to not take company-sponsored insurance ($125 paid out to me monthly) and a wellness hour that we were given each week (essentially a flex hour that was paid and we could take to do anything that promoted self care or wellness, including leaving early for the day).

job_title: Criminal Justice Court Liaison in Centennial, CO
pros: Great supervisors and a CEO that truly cares about its employees. Great benefits
cons: No yearly review for raise.

pros: Flexible, welcoming, strong values, good work/life balance
cons: Some disorganization, technology issues frequent

pros: PTO, Coworkers, Non-Profit, Caring Clinicians
cons: Bureaucratic, Lacks Sound Clinical Leadership, Established Culture of Accommodation

job_title: Behavior Therapist in Castle Rock, CO
pros: There are positives to working with AllHealth. One would be that I have the creativity to utilize evidenced based modalities in my work with my age group. They also have multiple training year round for different interests as a therapist. The supervisors are supportive and friendly while giving clear expectation as to what is needed to be completed. The upper management are supporting and always mindful of being trauma informed. I have received hand written letters from staff and supervisors to show appreciation for my hard work and it appears that they are always looking through a strength based lens.
cons: I understand that they have made multiple changes and moved different staff around to other locations. This shift was a challenge for some clients which proved difficult. However, Allhealth managed to begin shifting to be more trauma informed and staff friendly and hopefully it will stay this way for a while.

job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician in Parker, CO
pros: I have been working here FT for the past 5 years, and this agency has certainly grown in a positive direction. I appreciate the generous PTO we start with as well as benefits. I find there is a lot of flexibility here because Allhealth cares about its employees doing well. This may not have always felt like the case, but since our new CEO took over, there has definitely been a positive culture shift. and a dedication to transparency that was not present when I first started here. This has been an excellent entry level job and there is room for growth.
cons: Many of the cons come with community mental health centers in general-sometimes caseloads can get high if you are not on top of managing them, and sometimes we are not always able to serve clients needs because community mental health centers do have limitations that private practices would not.

pros: Everyone is always happy to help.  The agency fosters an appreciation for each person, as an individual.  No one is above the other at AllHealth, we all work as a team and the job isn't just your job or my job, it's everyone's job.  You allow step children to be covered under benefits, which is awesome!  The agency invests in their team members by allowing us to attend paid trainings.
cons: After almost one year of service, I have no down sides to report

review_title: Save your soul and don't work here!
pros: None I can think of, honestly. It's just a terrible company.
cons:
Everything! This company does not consider their employee's mental health and does not value their opinion. They want to make money and nothing else. I had 5 bosses in the time I worked at AllHell and would NEVER return to this company no matter what. I am licensed professional and their pay is crap. One does not get into this field to become rich but it is not too much to ask to be fairly compensated. My biggest problem is that no one listens to the employees when they bring problems though the appropriate channels. 

Save your self and find a different company. It is NOT worth it!!!

review_title: Great To Work As A Clinician
job_title: Case Manager in Castle Rock, CO
pros: Had a wonderful experience working within the PSR team. I was well-trained and had teammates that cared deeply for clients and professional development. The culture at the Castle Rock office specifically was wonderful. I always had someone I could use as a sounding board and could also expect thoughtful, client centered advice.
cons: Caseloads are high for some and then lower for others. Finding a way to really balance so everyone is using their strengths to better serve clients is something to look more and more into.

job_title: Mental Health Specialist in Littleton, CO
pros: The values and culture at AllHealth Network make this a wonderful place to work.  Having worked in community mental health for over 20 years, I have been very happy working for the organization thus far (it's been 3 months).  The leadership team is relational and kind and allows for transparency, which creates a culture of collaboration and "we are all in this together" mentality.  I feel appreciated and valued and I'm so glad I chose to work here.
cons: I do not have any cons to share.

pros: From the time I worked there, they were focused on the community and the people that need help. Everyone showed respect and kindness for everyone. The people that you work with was a very team oriented mind set.
cons: Sometimes they did not always honor those that face the client everyday, and that is when it can be challenging to move forward.

review_title: Great leadership makes all the difference
pros: This is an organization that is moving forward and takes its role in the community seriously.  The administration is flexible and understands that employees need to be heard and valued if they are to help the agency’s clients in a meaningful way.  I have had a wonderful experience as an employee here.
cons: So far I have encountered no downsides, other than the challenge any nonprofit has to pay its employees as much as it would like to.

pros:
The people I work with are amazing.
The company is moving forward in a positive direction. 
The mission of the company is felt at all levels of the company.
cons: The cost of the health benefits should be more affordable.

cons: Staff struggles with past events making it difficult to accept change as an overall culture among some

cons: Was let go for no reason after 2 weeks with no input of what I could change, no plan, and to explain it just that I appeared nervous and anxious and was too eager to start my job.  Really??  Waste of my time!

review_title: Great place to work and support the community.
pros: Mission driven organization that has grown stronger in recent years.  Great orientation process and good benefits.  Leadership team communicated well and values staff input.

pros: Flexible schedule, my director understands that life happens and allows for a flexible schedule when needed.  Can make up time or take PTO when needed and not made to feel guilty about it.
cons: In the business office, not much room for upward advancement, but not a big concern for me.
